summary.long: Habakkuk is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The burden that Habakkuk the prophet hath seen:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Till when, O Jehovah, have I cried, And Thou dost not hear? I cry unto Thee -- `Violence,' and Thou dost not save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why dost Thou shew me iniquity, And perversity dost cause to behold? And spoiling and violence [are] before me, And there is strife, and contention doth lift [itself] up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore doth law cease, And judgment doth not go forth for ever, For the wicked is compassing the righteous, Therefore wrong judgment goeth forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look ye on nations, and behold and marvel greatly. For a work He is working in your days, Ye do not believe though it is declared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, lo, I am raising up the Chaldeans, The bitter and hasty nation, That is going to the broad places of earth, To occupy tabernacles not its own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Terrible and fearful it [is], From itself its judgment and its excellency go forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Swifter than leopards have been its horses, And sharper than evening wolves, And increased have its horsemen, Even its horsemen from afar come in, They fly as an eagle, hasting to consume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wholly for violence it doth come in, Their faces swallowing up the east wind, And it doth gather as the sand a captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at kings it doth scoff, And princes [are] a laughter to it, At every fenced place it doth laugh, And it heapeth up dust, and captureth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then passed on hath the spirit, Yea, he doth transgress, And doth ascribe this his power to his god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art not Thou of old, O Jehovah, my God, my Holy One? We do not die, O Jehovah, For judgment Thou hast appointed it, And, O Rock, for reproof Thou hast founded it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Purer of eyes than to behold evil, To look on perverseness Thou art not able, Why dost Thou behold the treacherous? Thou keepest silent when the wicked Doth swallow the more righteous than he,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Thou makest man as fishes of the sea, As a creeping thing -- none ruling over him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of them with a hook he hath brought up, He doth catch it in his net, and gathereth it in his drag, Therefore he doth joy and rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he doth sacrifice to his net, And doth make perfume to his drag, For by them [is] his portion fertile, and his food fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth he therefore empty his net, And continually to slay nations spare not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On my charge I stand, and I station myself on a bulwark, and I watch to see what He doth speak against me, and what I do reply to my reproof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah answereth me and saith: `Write a vision, and explain on the tables, That he may run who is reading it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For yet the vision [is] for a season, And it breatheth for the end, and doth not lie, If it tarry, wait for it, For surely it cometh, it is not late.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, a presumptuous one! Not upright is his soul within him, And the righteous by his stedfastness liveth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And also, because the wine [is] treacherous, A man is haughty, and remaineth not at home, Who hath enlarged as sheol his soul, And is as death that is not satisfied, And doth gather unto itself all the nations, And doth assemble unto itself all the peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not these -- all of them -- against him a simile taken up, And a moral of acute sayings for him, And say, Wo [to] him who is multiplying [what is] not his? Till when also is he multiplying to himself heavy pledges?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not thy usurers instantly rise up, And those shaking thee awake up, And thou hast been for a spoil to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because thou hast spoiled many nations, Spoil thee do all the remnant of the peoples, Because of man's blood, and of violence [to] the land, [To] the city, and [to] all dwelling in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wo [to] him who is gaining evil gain for his house, To set on high his nest, To be delivered from the hand of evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast counselled a shameful thing to thy house, To cut off many peoples, and sinful [is] thy soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a stone from the wall doth cry out, And a holdfast from the wood answereth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wo [to] him who is building a city by blood, And establishing a city by iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, is it not from Jehovah of Hosts And peoples are fatigued for fire, And nations for vanity are weary?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For full is the earth of the knowledge of the honour of Jehovah, As waters cover [the bottom of] a sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wo [to] him who is giving drink to his neighbour, Pouring out thy bottle, and also making drunk, In order to look on their nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast been filled -- shame without honour, Drink thou also, and be uncircumcised, Turn round unto thee doth the cup of the right hand of Jehovah, And shameful spewing [is] on thine honour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For violence [to] Lebanon doth cover thee, And spoil of beasts doth affright them, Because of man's blood, and of violence [to] the land, [To] the city, and [to] all dwelling in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What profit hath a graven image given That its former hath graven it? A molten image and teacher of falsehood, That trusted hath the former on his own formation -- to make dumb idols?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wo [to] him who is saying to wood, `Awake,' `Stir up,' to a dumb stone, It a teacher! lo, it is overlaid -- gold and silver, And there is no spirit in its midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah [is] in His holy temple, Be silent before Him, all the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet concerning erring ones:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Jehovah, I heard thy report, I have been afraid, O Jehovah, Thy work! in midst of years revive it, In the midst of years Thou makest known In anger Thou dost remember mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God from Teman doth come, The Holy One from mount Paran. Pause! Covered the heavens hath His majesty, And His praise hath filled the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the brightness is as the light, He hath rays out of His hand, And there -- the hiding of His strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before Him goeth pestilence, And a burning flame goeth forth at His feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath stood, and He measureth earth, He hath seen, and He shaketh off nations, And scatter themselves do mountains of antiquity, Bowed have the hills of old, The ways of old [are] His.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Under sorrow I have seen tents of Cushan, Tremble do curtains of the land of Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Against rivers hath Jehovah been wroth? Against rivers [is] Thine anger? Against the sea [is] Thy wrath? For Thou dost ride on Thy horses -- Thy chariots of salvation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Utterly naked Thou dost make Thy bow, Sworn are the tribes -- saying, `Pause!' [With] rivers Thou dost cleave the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seen thee -- pained are mountains, An inundation of waters hath passed over, Given forth hath the deep its voice, High its hands it hath lifted up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sun -- moon -- hath stood -- a habitation, At the light thine arrows go on, At the brightness, the glittering of thy spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In indignation Thou dost tread earth, In anger Thou dost thresh nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast gone forth for the salvation of Thy people, For salvation with Thine anointed, Thou hast smitten the head of the house of the wicked, Laying bare the foundation unto the neck. Pause!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast pierced with his staves the head of his leaders, They are tempestuous to scatter me, Their exultation [is] as to consume the poor in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast proceeded through the sea with Thy horses -- the clay of many waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have heard, and my belly trembleth, At the noise have my lips quivered, Rottenness doth come into my bones, And in my place I do tremble, That I rest for a day of distress, At the coming up of the people, he overcometh it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though the fig-tree doth not flourish, And there is no produce among vines, Failed hath the work of the olive, And fields have not yielded food, Cut off from the fold hath been the flock, And there is no herd in the stalls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet I, in Jehovah I exult, I do joy in the God of my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah the Lord [is] my strength, And He doth make my feet like hinds, And on my high-places causeth me to tread. To the overseer with my stringed instruments!
verses.speaker: Narrator
